title: The World of the Hebrew Bible

In particular, the occupation of Canaan under Joshua is now seen to have been a comparatively peaceful process of occupation of those parts of Canaan that were not inhabited. The Israelites were probably not the only group involved in the occupation, and the stories of Joshua’s battles may reflect conflicts among settlers rather than wars of occupation. See further Meyers and Rogerson, “The Old Testament World
